sponsor.partnerMessage: Beth Bowen Dental Studio is a dental office unlike anything you've experienced. Their patients receive personalized, compassionate care from one of the most highly-skilled dentists in the area. They prioritize listening to and caring for their patients. Learn more here.

posts.title: New Chuy's Location Coming To NWA
posts.content:
The rumors that a popular Mexican restaurant chain was looking at Fayetteville locations are indeed true, and Chuy’s is coming to town. 

  • Where & when: The Fayetteville location will be in what is currently a Colton’s Steakhouse on 642 E. Millsap Rd. As of now, the timeline for an opening date for Chuy’s is unknown.
  • Number three: Chuy’s is a Tex-Mex chain with a parent company in Austin Texas. The first Arkansas location opened in Little Rock in 2013, and the second location opened in Rogers in 2014. Now Fayetteville is finally getting Arkansas’s third. 

Read Fayetteville Flyer’s full story HERE for more information.

posts.title: Walmart Reveals Final Plans For Two New Headquarter Buildings
posts.content:
The final plans for two amenity buildings on the Walmart corporate campus were revealed on Wednesday along with the Walton family’s investment of $225 million.

  • Amenity plans: In an effort to back the company’s mission and promise to “live better,” there will be a new 360,000 sq. ft Walton Family Whole Health & Fitness center and a new 73,000 sq. ft Child Care Center on the Walmart corporate campus. Child care was the most requested amenity from corporate associates. 
  • Features: The Whole Health & Fitness Center will include spaces for pickleball, tennis, basketball, volleyball, cricket, three swimming pools, yoga, weight training, and fitness rooms. The Child Care Center will support up to 500 children ranging from infants to Pre-K, and the care will be outsourced to a third party. 

For more information, click HERE. For a full, interactive campus tour, click HERE.

posts.title: DEI Task Force Plans Cultural Festival In Downtown Bentonville
posts.content:
In an effort to celebrate culture in community, Bentonville’s Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Community Task Force and Downtown Bentonville Inc. are hosting a free one-day festival April 23 on the Bentonville square. 

  • Cultural stage: The family-friendly festival will showcase and celebrate the music, dancing, food, art, and diverse activities for all those who attend to learn, taste, and experience the numerous cultures that call Bentonville home. 
  • Project: There will be several organizations offering cultural activities for the community to experience along with a community art project, “Building Community One Piece at a Time.” Attendees will have opportunity to paint puzzle pieces intended to fit together to form a mural. The festival will go from 4-9p. 

For more details, click HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Happy Friday! There's plenty happening around NWA. Here are some things we think are worth checking out:

  • Crawl: It's not too late to go to the biggest startup party of the year, tonight from 5-9p in Fayetteville.
  • Voices only: The Voice Jam A Cappella Festival is this Saturday at the Walton Arts Center.
  • Vendors: Vintage Market Days is happening at the Benton County Fair Grounds all weekend!
  • Movie night: The 112 Drive-In season in Fayetteville begins tonight!
  • Whiskey: There will be a Whiskey Festival at the Peel Mansion in Bentonville on Saturday - limited number of tickets are sold.
  • On the run: The Hogeye Marathon and Half Marathon is this Saturday in Springdale.
  • Fresh: At last, the Bentonville Farmers Market season kicks off this Saturday in downtown Bentonville.
  • Music: There's live music all over NWA this weekend, just take your pick!

Have a great weekend, be safe, and we'll see you Monday!

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Baseball: Nine former Hogs are on the MLB opening day rosters.
  • Spring activities: The City of Fayetteville is hosting a community Easter egg hunt this Saturday.
  • Artists: A local art gallery is seeking artists for an exhibition.
  • Biscuits: A Little Rock food truck is relocating to Bentonville.
  • Helping neighbors: The Ozark Ballet Theatre is raising funds to house three Ukrainian dance artists.
  • Scoot: A seated scooter pilot program is underway in Fayetteville.
  • Collab: Let's get your story out by putting you in the newsletter. Check out our advertising deals here.
